website_summaries.verdict: A bread slicer guide made from bamboo wood that works well for homemade bread.
pros: Folds for compact storage when not in use
cons: The model comes with a board for helping guide the bread but does not have a convenient space to store the board when folded

customer_reviews.title: Warning: This product could harm you.
customer_reviews.text: Great design and well made...BUT...If you slice a sliver of the bamboo while cutting bread and unknowingly ingest the sliver you can induce internal bleeding and passing of blood. The bamboo and the resin/epoxy do not show on X-rays. I was just lucky. I passed the problem quickly. It was a painful two hours but I did figure out what had happened and felt better. Check your sliced bread very carefully.
customer_reviews.author: J Lochaby

customer_reviews.title: Dimensions listed in product description are totally inaccurate.
customer_reviews.text: Dimensions listed in product description are totally inaccurate. Highest point is only 3.5" high, lowest is 3.25" (Why are they not all the same height?? Weird.) If you plan to use this in conjunction with your bread maker loaves, I guarantee it will not work. I have a fairly small bread maker. Loaves are 5.25" square, so this did not work for me. I am in the process of trying to return this item.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Better Sooner Than Never
customer_reviews.text: DB-Tech Bamboo Wood Compact Foldable Bread is the greatest item ever !! I ordered the Pullman Load Pan with cover that makes a Sandwich Loaf of bread and I ordered the Foldable Bread Slicer to slice my bread evenly. There is a small, medium, and large area to slice the bread and I use the medium setting for a regular looking slice of bread. The larger setting makes thicker bread for like croutons, and the smaller make a very thin bread for toasting and making breadcrumbs . It is completely foldable and stores without taking up a lot of space. This is a great idea and I wish I had found it sooner. Sandy Hatton
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Hatton

customer_reviews.title: i am so disappointed. i am looking for something that helps cut ...
customer_reviews.text: i am so disappointed. i am looking for something that helps cut the bread. this thing, i unpacked it and checked it and hurt my fingers! it is not well sanded! small little pointed bamboo pieces can go into your fingers and it's so terrible! i hope this review can help the manufacture to improve their product and stop this from happening to others!
customer_reviews.author: Quinnsi

customer_reviews.title: Not what it says it is.
customer_reviews.text: I measured my bread and it was 6.5 in.wide. This product says it comes in 2 sizes. 7.5 and 6.5 in.wide. I ordered the 6.5 in. Was I surprised that my bread did not fit. The 6.5 in. wide is really 5.5 inches wide.
customer_reviews.author: G.K.

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy little gadget and my kids really like it. But, it is very easy to cut the wood....we've got a lot of splinters hanging off the slats where it has been cut as we are cutting bread. On the plus side it won't dull your knife because it goes through the wood....imagine your knife trying to cut through something harder. And I would rather ingest tiny bits of wood than tiny bits of plastic, if the shavings ended up on the bread. So overall I would recommend and if we end up destroying it in six months with all the cuts I'd buy another one. It is very handy and looks nice and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Lovebooks

customer_reviews.title: Too wide
customer_reviews.text: I bake all my own bread so a slicer is a must. I've tried plastic slicers, but they're flimsy and awful, so I upgraded to this wooden one. It looks really nice and is easy to assemble. It folds flat for storage. The guides come in three widths, so you can choose thin or thick slices. The problem is that the slicer is too wide. Loaves tend to slide around, which makes the cuts uneven. And it's hard to keep the knife inside the slots on both sides--it barely reaches across. Overall, I'm disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: dephal

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use
customer_reviews.text: This bamboo in this is quite nice to see and touch. Unfortunately there are a couple of drawbacks to its design (or perhaps my environment) that make it hard to use. 1) It isn't quite tall enough to allow the knife to contact a tall loaf before being in both slots; 2) It's a bit wobbly (that adds to the problem of 1 quite a bit); 3) Bamboo is fairly soft and the if the bread knife contacts the bamboo, it tends to cut it (particularly at the top). Having said all that, it's usable, just not awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Brown

customer_reviews.title: Not Sure It Is Worth The $
customer_reviews.text: I make a two pound loaf of bread almost daily and it is a challenge to get the loaf into the slicer. My bread is considerable higher than the sides. My 8 inch bread knife could not reach across the sliver so I had to buy a 12 inch blade knife. The knife does nick/sever pieces of the bamboo slicing guide if I am not careful to keep the knife blade centered. I have concerns about long term. This needs a crumb catcher of some sort; not the easiest thing to dispose of the bread crumbs that gather.
customer_reviews.author: Maxie'nMe

customer_reviews.title: Bamboo shavings in food!
customer_reviews.text: Gave as gift and used in Nov 2019/Thanksgiving. What a disaster with bamboo shavings when bread cut. If knife blade hits any side of slatted knife holder you get bamboo slivers. unfortunately, she told me too late to return. I did try to use and see what happened. Same awful bamboo slivers on cutting board. I threw bread pieces away fearing some of slivers landed in bread. Did not want to take chances for anyone to get SICK from wood slivers. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: amzng

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Bread slicers are expensive! but this one seemed to be the lowest price one with good reviews so I tried it (and I also bought a large bread knife like another reviewer recommended too). I'm happy to report it works beautifully to make perfect slices just like an expensive automatic machine but with a little more work. You definitely need a large bread knife - I already have two smaller ones but I got one with a longer blade and combined together with this contraption I have perfect slices!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alice Xenia

customer_reviews.title: Must have for homemade bread!
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is an absolute must have for homemade bread. I could never evenly slice bread before this which made for some very lop sided sandwiches. This is perfect for perfectly sliced bread and I love the option to change up the thickness. It folds away SUPER easy which is awesome. The only thing that I wish it had was a built in crumb tray. Other products had this and I didn't think it would be that important, but it really would be a nice feature. Otherwise I love it and will never slice bread again without it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One flaw
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have realized it when I ordered it, but the slots are different sizes. It's not difficult to use but you do have to constantly move it if you want the same sized slices of bread. It works great with store bought or home made breads. It was definitely worth the money spent on it though even with the different sized slots. It collapses down for easy storage and it's easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Buy a different product
customer_reviews.text: I just do not like this product. I wish I would have a bought a plastic one. Even my husband who was helping me slice bread, found this product to be more of a hassle. Aside from it being either too wide for a regular sandwich loaf or too short for a tall breadmaker loaf, I often end up with wood pieces splintering. I also found that the base does not hold up, and has many cut makers through the wood making it hard to wipe clean. Buy a different product.
customer_reviews.author: megan spisak

customer_reviews.title: 5 Star Product just not for me.
customer_reviews.text: It came as advertised, it is and does what it claims. I find it too wide for my knives so have a hard time, even with my electric knife, using it easily. The easy storage, setup, and design means that most will probably love it. The quality is high. So I am giving it four stars but want to be clear that the removal of the last star is only to illustrate that for me it didn't work well enough to use it consistently.
customer_reviews.author: Sodamoca

customer_reviews.title: I think if it was made of heavy duty plastic it might better but the wood just doesn't work well
customer_reviews.text: My husband reminded me that I bought one of these years ago and ended up throwing it away. It is very difficult to cut the bread unless you keep your knife perfectly straight. Otherwise it cuts into the wood and you have wood shavings in your bread. Using this is way more work than just cutting the bread with out it. This will go to Goodwill. Not worth the money. I think if it was made of heavy duty plastic it might better but the wood just doesn't work well.
customer_reviews.author: Amy L Weller

customer_reviews.title: Love this bread slicer.
customer_reviews.text: I love this bread slicer. Pictured is a 1-lb bread load so you can see it can accommodate different sizes of bread. The bamboo is durable from cutting on it. I have been using it for a few weeks now and I can tell that this product will last me for many, many years. Also, it is easy to clean. The only thing I would recommend is that you purchase a long bread knife. It seems that my bread knife is just barely long enough for this slicer.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Cee

customer_reviews.title: If you buy or make home style bread you need this.
customer_reviews.text: A local bakery just opened in my area and I brought this so I could cut the loves evenly. I also bake my own bread. This is a very nice product. I watched the video in the reviews and did buy a small cutting board for the bottom of it. Make sure you buy a cutting board that is plastic and only 6 inches wide. I like you can cut the bread in different widths. It is nice and compact for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Nunya

customer_reviews.title: Nice slicer
customer_reviews.text: I think this item is a terrific idea but I have found it to be a bit awkward. Saying that, I have dexterity issues so it could be me. I have a long serrated knife that is a great size for this and once you get going, the slices are perfectly cut. I personally have to go at it slowly and I also put a small cutting board on the bottom of the slicer to protect the board from cutting marks. In a nutshell, it works as advertised and the slices come out great - much better than slicing it without the cutter so I do recommend it but it's slow going for me.
customer_reviews.author: S. Kahl

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Make sure knife is very long so cutting is smooth. Hold bread while cutting so bread won't slide. Make sure bread is hard not frozen but firm when cutting. I put in fridge overnight and cut the next day. Cutting with this is so easy. It took trial and error to get it right. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kay young

customer_reviews.title: Great slicer.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic bread slicer. It replaced a previous one that we bought on Amazon which was mad of plastic and wood. It was good, however this one far exceeds. It actually gives the option of different thickness of bread slices. My wife loves it, plus it folds down quite nicely, where as the previous one took up a lot of storage space.
customer_reviews.author: LoveAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Measure the bread you want to cut to make sure it will fit in the guide.
customer_reviews.text: Make my own bread often with a bread machine and was almot never ever to make a consitent slice. My machine turns out loaves that are taller than they are long or wide and have a wide crown. Have to position loaf on end to cut crown section and have to aim carefully to get knife into the guides which are about an inch lower. Once crown is gone, length of loaf fits between and below of guide tops. Bread baked in traditional bread pan would fit perfectly! Just easier to measure all the ingredients in the machine pan which automatically mixes ingredients then goes through the kneadings and baking turning out a perfect loaf 4 hours later.
customer_reviews.author: TRSJr

customer_reviews.title: It looks nice and I like that the bottom has non-slip feet
customer_reviews.text: It looks nice and I like that the bottom has non-slip feet, but the sides don't lock into place and keep moving when I try to slice the bread loaf. The removable panel doesn't keep the sides from shifting; it's more of a back so the loaf has something to rest against.
customer_reviews.author: Kaelin51

customer_reviews.title: broken
customer_reviews.text: Packaging seemed fine, except that it appeared to have been opened prior to getting to me..product however, was not. Upon opening and unfolding product to set it up, one of the upright bamboo guides just fell off. Upon further inspection one side of guide was not seated or cut properly and was cracked. One other of the guides was also loose and ready to fall off.Even if it was in new condition, seems like a very flimsy bread cutting guide that would not last very long. definitely would not recommend this product to anyone else.
customer_reviews.author: donna

customer_reviews.title: Great for Bread Bakers
customer_reviews.text: I decided to search for a gadget to help me slice my homemade loaves more evenly and chose this one. It is perfect. It has 3 different slice widths and now I can make even sandwich bread thin slices. I just choose the width I want and slice through the slots in that section. Its small, easy to use and it flattens into a rectangle not much thicker than a cutting board for easy storage. My serrated knife leaves marks on the cutting surface, but I don't see that as a problem. I love the simplicity of this product and would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily!
customer_reviews.text: This is not a quality product. The wood is low quality and flimsy. As some of the other reviewers have mentioned, it breaks easily. We only used it a few times and had to toss it in trash. Don't waste your money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: Need long enough knife & Numbered slats
customer_reviews.text: Make sure your knife BLADE is 8" or longer otherwise it won't reach all the way to the opposite side's slats. Love the varied sizes of the slats. Instead of counting the slats each time to make sure I get a straight cut, I numbered the top of each slat with a sharpie and works great (see pic).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thin slices but dull knife and cut board.
customer_reviews.text: I use an electric knife to cut my bread. In the process of doing so, as I reach the bottom of each slice, I am cutting the bottom of the board and in the process dulling my knife. I was able to get nice, even small slices which is what I prefer. If the other problem could be resolved then this would be prefect.
customer_reviews.author: dbk1227

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Does just what it is supposed to do. I like the way it folds so I can store it an a drawer when not in use. I've tried it with a pullman loaf of a nice peasant-style bread, and it works perfectly for that. If you had a large boule I imagine you would have to cut the boule in half before slicing it. 2-day delivery was on time.
customer_reviews.author: Peter F. Ash

customer_reviews.title: Attractive to look at, worthy of cutting good bread, but adults don't need measuring devices for slicing bread.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift to my son and his wife, who expressed pleasure and satisfaction at receiving it, but they were both brought up to be polite when given gifts. So I'm not sure of their honest opinion. I think they'll like it just fine, but I have a quibble. The base has a ridge down the middle and is slanted on both sides, and the crumbs aren't contained. Otherwise, the bread-cutter is well engineered.
customer_reviews.author: K. Donnelly

customer_reviews.title: A Nice Product for the Price
customer_reviews.text: A good value, and it works great. Drawbacks are it does take noticeable damage from use so I suspect I will be buying a replacement in a few years. Also it is not rigid when you set it up it will wobble a bit while you are cutting, but it folds up nice and small to be tucked away when not needed. You get nice even slices so your home made breads come out just like the factory sliced pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Johnston

customer_reviews.title: made alteration
customer_reviews.text: I went from a one-slice, plastic guide to this one. The one-slice was slow and was shredding. I like this one. It is well-made and seemingly good quality. It requires some getting used to and practice to get the slices even. Much faster than the one-slice. Doesn't shred. I read a customer review that said the bottom gets cut up. I got a cheap thin flexible cutting board and used a box cutter to cut it to fit in the bottom of this slicer. Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: happy

customer_reviews.title: Makes slicing bread very easy!
customer_reviews.text: I make bread with my bread machine, and always had a hard time cutting up the final "masterpiece". I could never get a good cut, so using the bread to make sandwiches was difficult. Now that I have this cutter guide, I get perfect cuts on the loafs! Also, it folds down so storage is compact and slim. Bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be well made and sturdy. Plenty wide enough to accommodate my bread maker bread. The only problem is that the upright guides are not tall enough for my bread. Fortunately I can lay it down on it's side and cut it that way. You will need a long knife at least 10" My 12" bread knife works very well. It's nice to have evenly sliced bread for a change.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Works for us.
customer_reviews.text: Very handy. There are three different slice sizes. Unfortunately the one we use is the one in the "dip" of the cutter and my homemade bread is taller than that. However, I don't view this as a problem. As it's made of bamboo my cutco bread knife can easily cut through the bottom if we're not careful. I bought a thin cutting board and cut it out in the shape of the bottom so it would protect the bottom a little. It is a little wobbly when you're cutting, especially if your bread isn't so wide. All in all I would recommend this to other people. Honestly there aren't that many bread cutting boards out there for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa and Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great for cutting multiple size slices!
customer_reviews.text: I have been please with the construction and flexibility of the product. The one thing that would make it even better were if the bottom was not bamboo. As it is now, the knife cuts into the bottom with every slice. I had my nephew fashion a piece of plastic for me to slide in and protect the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Copeland

customer_reviews.title: We purchased this product to make it easier to slice ...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this product to make it easier to slice the homemade bread that we make regularly. We were trying to find a solution that was easier to use than an electric knife and one that produced uniform slices. Unfortunately this bread slider was more time-consuming to use than an electric knife, and after 2 uses, we are back to using our electric knife.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Kempner

customer_reviews.title: Greatest Thing Since Sliced Bread!
customer_reviews.text: Wife makes bread regularly and now slices bread "regularly". She loves the slicer guide. I love that she loves it. As long as she makes me bread I will love it also. I love her for more than bread baking. So the moral is we think it is worth the price and effort. You need a long bread knife, but if you don't have one Amazon will sell you one.
customer_reviews.author: Olfart

customer_reviews.title: Weird scent but good slicer
customer_reviews.text: almost perfect! It has rubber stoppers to keep it from wiggling all over, it's adjustable for thinner loaves, it's attractive enough to leave on my counter. The reason for the loss of 1 star is because it REEKS of what I can only assume is oil of some sort. It's a very strange, sweet, almost floral scent with a medicine like hint to it. My husband thought I'd spilled childrens Tylenol on it. It leeched into the bread and make the bottom crust taste like it. It's pretty awful, but now that it's pretty much gone, I really love the slicer.
customer_reviews.author: Alana K. Hawker

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: According to the seller this will cut sourdough round breads, i measure it and all and is too small for those breads. Not happy that i was miss lead, i will keep it anyway for other types of breads.
customer_reviews.author: Nora Villalobos

customer_reviews.title: Much better than slicing by hand with no guide! I like this.
customer_reviews.text: I bake bread and slice it in this slicer. I like the thicker slices. Sometimes I get thinner or thicker slices, I think I may be squeezing the loaf to make it stay still while I slice. However, it is much better than when I try slicing by hand. Much better! I like it. I'm going to keep using it. I did get a small slicing pad to protect the wood from the knife slices.
customer_reviews.author: JeanieSean

customer_reviews.title: If you make bread and need a slicer this one works!
customer_reviews.text: Much better than the plastic one I had but has a drawback. The cuts to follow for slicing the bread are not very even. One side has a tight space and the corresponding guide on the other side has a loose space. There are three different sizes as you go along the length of the slicer which is a good thing. Sometimes you need thin slices sometimes thick and this accommodates those cuts very well. Seems pretty sturdy so it should hold up well but only time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G. Norris

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: Considering this my first bread slicer it is the best one I ever bought. Seriously though, it works as advertised, folds neatly, looks nice and is easy to set up and use. Worth the money for sure! The only thing I needed was a longer bread knife to give me my needed pull / push stroke slicing motion without disengaging from the slicer on the far side. This is the one I bought and it is almost overkill.(
customer_reviews.author: J Bruning

customer_reviews.title: Every home bread baker should have one
customer_reviews.text: Slicing guide for three thicknesses of bread, and would accommodate even a very wide loaf. Folds flat for storage, it is something never thought I needed, but now I’d never bake bread without.
customer_reviews.author: Mickeydid

customer_reviews.title: Side wall issues
customer_reviews.text: Nice product but i wished it would lock in better. The side walls move around a lot when your trying to cut the bread
customer_reviews.author: Jessica S

customer_reviews.title: Poor build
customer_reviews.text: The only way this thing works right is if your bread is exactly the side of the slicer and then just barely. The knife slots aren't really even. The whole thing moves when you are using it. I feel like i'm going to cut myself. Wasted money. Note: I purchased BOTH sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Charles C. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Picture worth a thousand words...
customer_reviews.text: Works great for me. I went ahead and applied mineral oil to it like I did on my cutting board. I used my Dalstrong bread knife (pictured) to slice this loaf of European Herb and Cheese bread that I made today. 4 stars b/c a heavy knife, like mine, has a tendency to carve into the sides of the slats unless I am careful.
customer_reviews.author: Andy B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea but too flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I bake a lot of bread and this would be a great way to make uniform slices but it is too flimsy. I like the wood and the color and design it just needs to be more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Mn poet 09

customer_reviews.title: Here is the first thing i used it on
customer_reviews.text: This little bread cutter is really cool, it folds up and opens nack up easily and you can cut bread in three different thicknesses. I have enclosed a picture of the first thing i used it on. How did it do? I love mine.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Craft

customer_reviews.title: My family is finally getting sandwiches that look like they are supposed to
customer_reviews.text: I am on my second one of these, because the first one was broken in the box, when it arrived. But making the exchange for a new one, was not a big inconvenience. The only negative thing I can say about the second one is, that it doesn't hold the bread firmly while slicing. But overall it has been a huge help in the kitchen! I always bake my own bread and am not very skilled with a knife. My family is finally getting sandwiches that look like they are supposed to, thanks to my new bread slicer!
customer_reviews.author: Rae

customer_reviews.title: VERY PRETTY DESIGN
customer_reviews.text: I like to have my slices very thin and wanted them to be the same size and perfectly sliced. Well, while this is very nice to look at (and can be easily folded up and put away in a small kitchen), it isn't able to slice as thin as I like and after using a few times, I wondered why I thought I needed guidance to slice a loaf of bread. At least now I know I was doing okay without it. However, I still like the appearance and I'm hoping I can find another use for it like maybe holding recipe sheets or cards or something.
customer_reviews.author: Calamity Jane

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the trouble just cut the bread without a guide.
customer_reviews.text: I plan on returning it. I don’t like it it’s kinda hard to use to make sure your not going to accidentally cut the bamboo. It seems like the lines aren’t lined up as good as possible. But nice idea.
customer_reviews.author: BooBoo

customer_reviews.title: and the bamboo is not very high quality - the sides splinter very easily, and the cutting surface has deep gouges on ...
customer_reviews.text: This does the job, but the first one we received was very wobbly. We were sent a replacement which is not wobbly, but the sides still lock into place at an awkward angle, and the bamboo is not very high quality - the sides splinter very easily, and the cutting surface has deep gouges on it from gentle slicing.
customer_reviews.author: Kyleian

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bread Slicer
customer_reviews.text: I have a DAK bread machine. I cut my loaf in half, fits the slicer perfect. I cut a little tray from a plastic cutting board to go in under my bread so I don’t cut the wood. I also use a 9 inch electric knife to slice my bread.
customer_reviews.author: C. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Needs Care Instructions
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. I like that it folds up. I like that it has 3 different widths to cut the bread. I appreciate the video that the one user made showing how to use it. That is very helpful. The one drawback is that no care instructions came with it. I researched the internet and found care instructions. I handwashed it before first use, let it dry thoroughly, and rubbed a food-grade oil all over it. I also put oil on a folded paper towel and placed it between each slat to oil the slots. I keep it in the cabinet and hand wash it occassionally. Will oil it occassionally also.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Not a good buy!
customer_reviews.text: I really have not been happy with this product. The thickness slices are mixed. It really is hard to get even slices because you can only slice a few not the whole loaf.
customer_reviews.author: LIG LP

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't sit level
customer_reviews.text: This works OK. It doesn't sit level. When slicing bread from my bread machine, the loaf doesn't fit well. The area inside the slicker is too wide and not tall enough to fit the loaves correctly. But it I start slicing from the side, I can make it work. It's just not as easy as I was hoping.
customer_reviews.author: LHH

customer_reviews.title: I re-glued it (very easy repair). I'm hoping the repair will hold up ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used the bread slicer yet (it's a Christmas present) but I do need to comment on the device I received. When I checked out the slicer the end of the retainer board had come off. I re-glued it (very easy repair). I'm hoping the repair will hold up when we put the bread slicer to work. P.S. After a year of use the re-glue job did hold up and after getting used to slicing bread with the bread slicer we find that it works well. It is difficult to cut the last two slices straight but still it is better than cutting without the slicer. We fold and store it after every use. The folding feature works well.
customer_reviews.author: James Campbell

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I have started to make the bread we eat because I have a bread machine, and that is one less thing to buy at the supermarket. Cutting the bread is a problem, but with this little "gadget" I can get even slices. It was easy to put together and it worked as I expected it to. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Howard

customer_reviews.title: Best I've found so far
customer_reviews.text: All bread slicing guides seem to do a decent job of guiding a knife for even slices. One of the things that annoys me about homemade and artisan (unsliced) breads is that slicing them manages to throw crumbs all over the kitchen. Of the several bread slicing guides I've tried so far, this one does the best job of containing the crumbs. I recommend it, although I admit that I will continue my quest (improbable though it might be) to find a slicing guide that contains all crumbs. I also like the fact that it folds to take up less storage space.
customer_reviews.author: pm

customer_reviews.title: If you make bread at home, this is a good guide to have
customer_reviews.text: This is the second bread cutting guide we order, we now have one for each home. It can be folded to take less space when not in use, has guides for different thickness of bread slices. Just hace to be careful to make sure the knife is straight between the slots not the damage the wood
customer_reviews.author: A fan of period epics

customer_reviews.title: It’s awkward to use
customer_reviews.text: It’s nice quality bamboo and folds flat for easy storage. My complaint I have to hold on with one hand to both wooden sides and the loaf itself to keep the loaf steady in order to use the knife in the other hand. Once I do that, I can cut nice slices but it’s very awkward. Am I doing something wrong??
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The is a very good guide for slicing bread
customer_reviews.text: The is a very good guide for slicing bread, the only problem I had was keeping the guides from flopping around. To resolve this I had to push the bread against the end panel while holding the nearest guide. Not really a big deal but I get consistent thickness with the slices. The only other minor complaint is the cutting surface. It seemed to me there was varnish on it. I removed the board a sanded it smooth. No sense in eating varnish.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I liked that this bread guide was bamboo and had graduated cutting sizes. The problem I have with it is the width. There is nothing to hold the loaf firmly while slicing. I am unable to get slices of even thickness. I will have to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: NCPhotogirl

customer_reviews.title: It is not as stable as it could be,
customer_reviews.text: It works well. They could make an improvement in holding the sides together as they tend to wobble as you slice the bread. All they have to do is add another piece of wood on the end panel so that the sides are actually locked together . That would stop the wobbling.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin T.

customer_reviews.title: It seems the key is to use a good quality bread knife which doesn't bend
customer_reviews.text: This does make more uniform slices than without using it. It seems the key is to use a good quality bread knife which doesn't bend, keeping the loaf firmly in a 90 degree angle if it's narrower than the bread slicer guide and, as in one of the other reviews, using a small plastic cutting board underneath the bread. Also, it helps to score the bread at least on the top 2 corners to get the slice started.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Baur

customer_reviews.title: Bread Slicer
customer_reviews.text: While I have used this numerous times to cut loaves of beer bread, it does take a steady hand and a good grip to accomplish the task.
customer_reviews.author: G. Barbier

customer_reviews.title: great bread slicer
customer_reviews.text: Came as described. I am very capable of cutting bread but the slicer does an excellent job of guiding the cut, giving a consistent cut and increasing the yield because of the uniformity in slicing..
customer_reviews.author: John E. Newsom

customer_reviews.title: works great, be careful using a regular bread knife because ...
customer_reviews.text: works great, be careful using a regular bread knife because towards the bottom will scrape the bamboo. Compact and love the three slice thickness.
customer_reviews.author: LittleSmalls

customer_reviews.title: No more uneven slices in this house!
customer_reviews.text: This little beauty has erased my frustration of slicing homemade bread into sandwich-width pieces. I toyed with the idea of buying this months before I purchased it. I don't know why I waited so long. The backplate can be placed into any corresponding slots to accommodate loaves of any length. Addtionally, one end allows for wider slices while the other will give you more narrow slices. AND it folds down flat for minimal storage! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Catlius of M45

customer_reviews.title: Really flimsy, wouldn’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: It helps with even slicing, but it’s hard to use because it’s so flimsy. The sides wobble like crazy while slicing. I’ll be upgrading soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Hollier

customer_reviews.title: decent
customer_reviews.text: its alright.. very wide, we will have to get another knife to cut with.. on a standard kitchen knife set, you will have maybe 1/2-1inch left over on the side to do the sawing with. I would usually do 2-3 storks to cut bread, with this its many times more than that. the slits are a little close, making it hard/worry-some about not cutting the bamboo as well.. I like that it folds for easier storage, and the different thicknesses. I would like it a LOT better if it was just a little more narrow to slice bread easier.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa

customer_reviews.title: I like that it allows for different widths of slices
customer_reviews.text: This is a nifty, well-designed and well-made device. I like that it allows for different widths of slices. My only complaint is that it is very wide, so my usual bread knives can only go back and forth about 3/4ths of an inch without disengaging from the far side.
customer_reviews.author: knickerbocker

customer_reviews.title: Not the product for me
customer_reviews.text: The sides don't hold real firm, they are a bit wobbly once in place to slice the bread. Difficult to hold them and the bread in one place while cutting. There are 3 different sizings, however you shouldn't use an electric knife as you'll like slice slivers of wood into your bread. The compact design and different sizing is what attracted me to this product, but I really don't care for it after mutilating 4 loafs of homemade bread. :(
customer_reviews.author: C Mihm

customer_reviews.title: Slices Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: During this crisis of COVID 19, making our own bread has been extremely helpful. Slicing our bread perfectly is great. We love the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good price and design, but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Nice Compact design that folds up for storage. Works well. Only down side is that I needed to buy a longer bread knife because 7 inch wasn't long enough to reach across the gap. Happy with my purchase and the price was right
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J Hopken

customer_reviews.title: Very nice bread cutter slicer
customer_reviews.text: This is amazingly nice particularly after I started making my own bread. One thing be sure to purchase a very long knife.
customer_reviews.author: justMeLat

customer_reviews.title: not sturdy. We could not use it at all and ...
customer_reviews.text: We make our own bread and it is wider than your average store bought loaf. We were hoping this would help our kids with slicing their own bread. However, the bread was completely swallowed up by this contraption and it was impossible for my husband and I to successfully use. There was no way to keep the bread from moving around while slicing. The slices came out very uneven as a result of the sliding around and the bread always looked torn up. It was very shaky, not sturdy. We could not use it at all and threw it away. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it once so far and I love it. I really like that you can slice different sizes and not waste any of the bread. It is a very sturdy bread slicer and it can be folded and tucked away, which I like a lot since I'm short on counter space. All in all, this seems to be a great product which I highly recommend .
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Very useful for slicing homemade breads evenly. Easy to assemble and clean. Fits nicely in a drawer when disassembled.
customer_reviews.author: kariN

customer_reviews.title: The Best I have Found, However....
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great product. It is well made and functions as promised. You may need a bread knife longer then 10" for this unit to work best. I would make to suggestions to improve an already great product. Provide more variation in the size of the slices. Also, the base will become scored over time with repeated slicing. Some guidance on how to deal with this would be very helpful. I plan to sand the scoring but this can only be done a limited number of times. Don't get me wrong. I love this slicer.
customer_reviews.author: David S

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use.
customer_reviews.text: Anyone can use this. It folds up - good thing. I thing thinnest one is probably best. Knife reaches across better
customer_reviews.author: 4 buying stuff

customer_reviews.title: This bread slicer makes even slices.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the slice sizes doable with this slicer. When others cut my homemade bread the cuts were all over the place, my friends don’t have the experience to slice it evenly. When I’m done with it just wipe it down, fold it up, and store in the box it came in.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen L

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived yesterday and was so excited to use it since I’ve been making bread at home while we practice social distancing because of COVID-19but the quality is lacking. It really is a cheaply made product. I am very disappointed by its lack of quality.
customer_reviews.author: LLM5716

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use since I’m making my own bread. Beautiful, easy to use, very convent as it folds for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy K Myers

customer_reviews.title: Simple but excellent solution.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, folds flat, and it's easy to flip up the side for use. I took the advice of some here and slipped a piece of a plastic cutting sheet onto the tray. I also oiled mine with the oil I use for my butcher block.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: It looks tough but just okay
customer_reviews.text: I had it for about 4 months and have been using it about once every 1.5 week. Today, one side broke into three pieces and two of them fell out when I pulled it out of the box this morning. I wasn't quiet sure if I am going to keep the product as it is not as useful as I thought it would be. It is not easy to hold the bread while cutting the bread. It gave you just a little more guidelines than cutting the bread without it. I decided to send it back this morning when it was totally unusable.
customer_reviews.author: rmisasa

customer_reviews.title: For dull knives only?
customer_reviews.text: This bread holder slicer thingy is okay. Had I been thinking proactively I woud have looked for one of these with either a ceramic or other sort of base that would not become scored every time one slices a bread roll. Maybe it will last 3 years, then, fall apart from being sliced by a hand sharpened bread knife. I dunno. I won't buy this product again nor would I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Davis

customer_reviews.title: I really like this bamboo slicing board
customer_reviews.text: I really like this bamboo slicing board. I ordered a custom made 4.75" x 10" Poly cutting board to use with it to protect bamboo base from knife cuts when I'm slicing. You also have to be careful not to slice into the vertical slats when slicing. I did cut one slat which I fixed by with a glass fingernail file. Like most things, you just need to take care and you'll get many years of service. It folds nicely and I keep it next to my cookbooks on one of my kitchen shelves. Thanks for the fast delivery.
customer_reviews.author: T. A. Stern

customer_reviews.title: Mold all over....
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed to receive the bamboo foldable bread slicer. The product I received is covered with MOLD everywhere!!! It's made in China and probably been sitting in the warehouse for who knows how long. I also have a serious concern about health and allergy issues. This is for cutting breads!!! How can Amazon sell & ship such product to customers? It's totally unacceptable! It should be removed from Amazon. I am returning the product. DO NOT waste your time to order this product!!!
customer_reviews.author: L. C.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Happy with this but probably wouldn't buy it again. It is a nice piece and goes nicely in our kitchen but the loaves of bread I make are on the larger side and it is hard to get a good grip on both sides of the bread cutter - so sometimes the pieces come out a little broken. The sides fold down for a nice compact way to put it away but it also makes it so the sides aren't completely stable.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda M.

customer_reviews.title: I really like how it can be compactly tucked away
customer_reviews.text: I just need a longer knife, so not having one makes it a little difficult to cut (not necessary the fault of the manufacturer, although being a little narrower might do the trick). Otherwise, I really like how it can be compactly tucked away. Easy to clean and I love the bamboo because it does not splinter.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy H. Shelton

customer_reviews.title: this bread slicer guide is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: this is such a clever design, folds neatly, takes little space, loos great and really works. no more wedge shaped slices for us!
customer_reviews.author: gloria

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great! The only downside is that my bread machine ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! The only downside is that my bread machine makes loaves taller than the side walls, so you kind of have to guess for the first inch or so of each slice. On the whole, however, you wind up with MUCH more even slices.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Anglemyer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work for Us
customer_reviews.text: I ended up giving this away. Every time I cut the bread the bamboo bread guides got cut, too and little slivers came off. I wish it would have worked out because I am a bad bread slicer. Maybe it was me? Maybe it's the bamboo bread slicer? I hope it works better for others because I feel bad leaving 2 stars. It just didn't work out for us.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Lil Family

customer_reviews.title: On the whole happy but as per other reviews the bamboo has started ...
customer_reviews.text: On the whole happy but as per other reviews the bamboo has started to get cut/damaged as we have cut bread. And the while the unit is approx 6" high the actual cutting area from the base of the board is about 4" which means that our home baked 2lb bread sits way about the cutting line - that is certainly less than ideal ...
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Fitzsimmons

customer_reviews.title: Could use a little improvement.
customer_reviews.text: This works as described; however, I think they should include a small cutting board, or something, to protect the wood. We happened to have a cutting board that fits perfectly on here, but would be nice if they included one so it doesn't get all cut up. The only other comment I would make is that there are little slivers of wood between all the slats that I'm concerned will get in my bread while I'm cutting the slices. Wish they would have sanded them or something.
customer_reviews.author: Discerning Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Great way to slice cabbage into steaks for roasting
customer_reviews.text: Great way to slice cabbage into steaks for roasting. I like roasted cabbage but it is a difficult task to cut the cabbage. This is marvelous little gadget to slice up cabbage without a trip to the ER. The cabbage fits perfectly in between the guides and then you can pick your thickness of cabbage steaks.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Samet

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, but still not completely sure of the durability
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, the bamboo is attractive, and works as advertised. However, to be honest. I've used others that just seemed sturdier, made of plastic, and have been happier. Looks good and expensive vs. less costly and a tad more durable. If you use such a board occasionally then it should be fine, but if you use more frequently you may wish to look at something else.
customer_reviews.author: T Shank

customer_reviews.title: slightly better than freehand
customer_reviews.text: It's nice that it folds and that you can move the loaf to different areas for different size slices. The knife guide openings are relatively wide which contributes to less consistent slicing. With a sharp knife it is easy to cut into the bamboo. My loaves were a bit taller than this guide which further reduced the ability to slice accurately. All in all this is slightly better than freehand slicing.
customer_reviews.author: Winemaker949

product_meta.description:
Size:6 ½ " - Narrow VersionAre you tired of your homemade bread not being sliced evenly? Of having odd pieces of bread leftover for the trash? We've got the solution for you and it’s quite simple! Slicing bread with this DB-Tech bread slicer has never been easier; just place the bread in the slicer and cut you knife along the grooves to create a perfect slice every time. This slicer can slice 3 different thicknesses, an average store bought slice of bread is 1cm thick; this slicer allows you to cut your bread in 0.8cm, 1cm and 1.2cm slice giving you the ultimate variety, and if you enjoy really thick slices you can slice your bread in every other slot to produce an even thicker slice. The slicer is made from 100% bamboo wood and is extremely durable. Its spring loaded flip out design makes it easy to quickly open and fold it away in 2-3 seconds for easy storage

- Designed to fold easily for compact storage 
- Made form 100% bamboo Wood, Natural, environmental friendly and pollution free 
- Great for bakery and homemade bread, even loaf cakes 
- Dimensions: 12” x 7 ½ x 6 ½ (high) Folded: 12” x 7 ½ x 1 ½ (high)
